Show HN: Step CI API Testing and Monitoring Tool Now Open Source
text:
Hi, this is Mish and Sebastian. We’re building Step CI, a Continuous Integration platform that lets you test, monitor and secure your APIs.

Step CI Command Line Interface and test runner are now open source on GitHub (https://github.com/stepci/stepci). Our goal is to build the best tool for managing APIs, so we decided to share our work with the open-source community.

We want to make it easy and free to use Step CI, no login required.

With Step CI, we offer a simple way to write tests that are programming-language independent and work for different API paradigms (REST, GraphQL, XML).

We started working on Step CI after meeting on YC’s Startup School. Mish is responsible for the tech, while Sebastian takes care of business operations.

We’d very much appreciate if you could try our product and give us feedback. Thank you to all who have already contibuted!

You can also reach out to us via e-mail (hello@stepci.com) or our matrix community (https://matrix.to/#/#stepci:matrix.org).

Thanks in advance for trying our tool!

Mish and Sebastian

Ask HN: Is Braintree on its death bed?
text:
I've been using Braintree as a way to interface with Paypal subscriptions for 8 years now.

Paypal recently upped their subscription game with a better SDK, but I still prefer Braintree as I have 8 years of customer data sitting there. But I'm having second thoughts. Braintree seems like it's just waiting to die. My experience:

- I sent two support requests into Braintree 8 days ago. I received an auto-response but then nothing.

- I setup a couple issues on their github also 8 days ago and nothing. I don't assume that there needs to be any SLA here so this could be a moot point.

- Their documentation is out of date. Most of the features are completely undocumented and I have to go through the source code on github to understand what params I should be using

- Also on their docs, I would run into 404s.

Is it time to throw in the towel and just build subscriptions direct with PayPal? What is your experience recently with braintree?

Ask HN: Should CTO own company shares?
text:
I am CTO in one small company for about 2 years (company was founded 5+ years ago). The salary is not competitive - maybe better paid senior developer position. And I am now struggling with my inner me - team is great and lot of interesting challenges, but building the company for someone else is ...demotivating. We had couple of great ideas and I even started working on those in my free time, but then it hits again "Should I really work on this new idea when it is owned by someone else?".

Does anyone have the same problem? Should C-level management own company shares? Or is it just my personal problem?

Show HN: Simple web tool for Bayesian optimization
text:
I use Bayesian optimization / black-box optimization for various engineering tasks, and I teach students to, too. I built this tool to make it really easy to just start doing an optimization at any time with no setup, infra, etc. Basically, this is my "once and for all" optimization installation, for projects, for work, and to offer to students for their homework and projects.

If you're tuning any parameters by hand (ex., hyperparameters in AI/ML) and tracking them in a spreadsheet, you should just be able to cut and paste your table into Cogneato and become more efficient.

Ask HN: Gamification of Learning Guitar
text:
I will happy waste hours playing PUBG (badly) but invest very little time in practising the guitar, which is ultimately way cooler and would win me the respect and admiration of my peers.

Are there any good apps/tools out there to encourage me to focus on shredding those sick riffs?
